title: Non-Squarefree Products Property
content: A set A has this property if for all a,b ∈ A, the product ab is not squarefree. This means every product is divisible by some p² for a prime p.

title: Optimal Set Construction
content: The optimal set is: even numbers ∪ odd non-squarefree numbers. Equivalently: all numbers except odd squarefree numbers.

title: Even Products Not Squarefree
content: The product of two even numbers is divisible by 4 = 2², hence not squarefree. This is why even numbers can all be included.

title: Maximal Sets Contain Non-Squarefree Numbers
content: Any maximal set with the property must contain all non-squarefree numbers, since their products with anything are automatically non-squarefree.

title: Intersecting Family
content: A set of squarefree numbers where any two share a prime factor. The problem reduces to finding the maximum intersecting family among squarefree numbers.

title: Chvátal's Result
content: The maximum intersecting family of squarefree numbers up to N is achieved by taking all squarefree multiples of a fixed prime. The optimal choice is prime 2 (even squarefree numbers).

title: Weisenberg's Proof
content: Weisenberg proved that the optimal set (even ∪ odd non-squarefree) achieves the maximum among all sets with the non-squarefree product property.

title: Alexeev-Mixon-Sawin Proof
content: An independent alternative proof of the same result.

title: Asymptotic Density
content: The optimal set has density 1 - 4/π² ≈ 0.595 since odd squarefree numbers have density 4/π² ≈ 0.405.

title: Complete Characterization
content: The complete solution: (1) The optimal set has the property, (2) No larger set has it, (3) The optimal set is exactly even numbers ∪ odd non-squarefree numbers.
